Text: Capped Upside, Negative Cost  As of Friday's close, this was the optimal, or least expensive, collar to hedge 1,000 shares of MO against a >20% decline by late March, if you were willing to cap your possible upside at 10% by then. Screen capture via the Portfolio Armor iPhone app  The cost here was negative, meaning you would have collected a net credit of $270, or 0.66% of position value, when opening this hedge.
